sarathy_groups wrote:
> Hi all,
> 
> I have a independent component written as pl/sql stored procedure.
> I have started with writing junits for it,
> 
> I used  " call procedure name" from Java to call the pl/sql stored
> procedure .
> 
> To check 4 assertEquals r assertTrue , I manually emptied the oracle
> table using truncate query and then called the pl/sql procedure which
> is to check whether the table is empty or not,
> 
> finally I got the count of the table using a query (select count(*)
> from <table name> )after executing tat pl/sql procedure to see
> whether its 0 or not
> 
> and assertEquals(query=="0",true) for junit testing,
> 
> its working fine but my doubt is , "is there any better way of doing
> the same for testing the functionality of a pl/sql stored procedure?"

There is something out there called PL/SQLUnit. I have never tried it, 
but it might be worth investigating.

I would probably do what you're doing: invoke the stored procedure from 
some other programming language. I would probably choose Ruby instead of 
Java, but my general approach would be the same.
-- 
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
